paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the TTR gene, specifically focusing on the V30M mutation and its implications in familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP).

patients.phenotype: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) with symptoms including polyneuropathy, thermal hyperalgesia, dysesthesia, gastrointestinal symptoms, orthostatic hypotension, and numbness in the hands and feet.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation leads to the formation of TTR-derived amyloid fibrils, contributing to the pathogenesis of FAP.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M variant is known to segregate with disease in families affected by FAP.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is the most common mutation associated with FAP worldwide.
key_quotes: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) is a neurodegenerative disease caused by deposition of mutated transthyretin (TTR)-derived amyloid fibrils in several organs.
Amyloidogenic TTR (ATTR) V30M was first identified, and is the most common mutation worldwide.

patients.demographics: 1 non-LT ATTR FAP patient, sex not specified
patients.phenotype: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) with symptoms similar to those of V30M patients.

functional_data.summary: The functional impact of the Y114C variant on TTR stability and amyloid formation is not detailed in the paper.

variants.additional_notes: The Y114C variant is less common than V30M and its clinical significance is still being evaluated.

patients.demographics: 1 non-LT ATTR FAP patient, sex not specified
patients.phenotype: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) with symptoms similar to those of V30M patients.

functional_data.summary: The functional impact of the I107V variant on TTR stability and amyloid formation is not detailed in the paper.

variants.additional_notes: The I107V variant is less common than V30M and its clinical significance is still being evaluated.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted successfully.
